page.title: 13SMEATHARPE - EDUCATION
page.content: Smeatharpe Village School was built in 1871 by Lord Sidmouth when part of the village belonged to his estate. It was closed due to falling numbers of children in the 196Os and now is a house. To-day, local children from the age of 3 to 5 can attend the Rainbow Play- group in Upottery, twice weekly. From the age of 5 to 11 most children go to Upottery County Primary School and afterwards continue secondary educ- ation at Honiton Community College. Here they can take O and A level exam- inations. Parents also have the choice of other state or private schools. Of the 26 children in Smeatharpe, 1 child goes to the Playgroup; l to Churchstanton Primary; 12 to Upottery Primary; 1 to Queen's College,Taunton, (private secondary school); and 11 to Honiton Community College.
